gw.datatype.handler

Interface IDecimalPersistenceHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDataTypePersistenceHandler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CurrencyAmountPersistenceHandler, DecimalPersistenceHandler, NormalizedExchangeRatePersistenceHandler

    public interface IDecimalPersistenceHandler
extends IDataTypePersistenceHandler
    Subclass of persistence handler for decimal values.
    Author:
    pdalbora

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getPrecision()
      Gets the precision of values for this datatype.
      int getScale()
      Gets the scale of values for this datatype.

      • Methods inherited from interface gw.datatype.handler.IDataTypePersistenceHandler

        applicationToBean, beanToApplication, beanToJdbc, getJdbcType, getSize, jdbcToBean

    • Method Detail

      • getPrecision

        int getPrecision()
        Gets the precision of values for this datatype. The precision is defined as the number of decimal digits required to represent this value in non-scientific notation. This number includes the getScale() of this datatype. For example, a decimal datatype with a precision of 10 and a scale of 2 can have at most 8 digits to the left of the decimal point (as 2 are reserved for the fractional part).

      • getScale

        int getScale()
        Gets the scale of values for this datatype. The scale is defined as the number of decimal digits to the right of the decimal point for values of this datatype.
